source_techmeme.title: Airtable launches Superagent, a new research product
source_techmeme.summary: Superagent allows users to deploy AI subagents to interrogate topics and create reports, slides, and websites.

source_techmeme.title: Notion CEO Ivan Zhao on AI's impact on software
source_techmeme.summary: Discussion on whether AI is 'killing' software companies and the future of SaaS.

source_techmeme.title: Claude Code: What happens after coding is solved
source_techmeme.summary: Boris Cherny, Head of Claude Code at Anthropic, discusses the future of software development.

source_techmeme.title: Davos 2026: AI takes center stage
source_techmeme.summary: Discussions at the World Economic Forum regarding AI's impact on global economy and security.

source_wsj.title: Global Memory Chip Crisis Looming
source_wsj.summary: Shortage of memory chips (RAM) is affecting electronics prices and delaying product launches like the next PlayStation.

source_wsj.title: Big Tech Earnings: AI Demand Exceeds Supply
source_wsj.summary: Microsoft, Google, and Amazon report that they cannot keep up with AI compute demand despite record CapEx.

stratechery_analysis.key_theme: Thin Is In (The Return of the Thin Client)
stratechery_analysis.summary: Ben Thompson argues that AI is bringing back the 'thin client' paradigm. Unlike the PC/Mobile era (thick clients), AI interactions (chat, agents) happen in the cloud. The local device's compute power matters less than its connectivity and the cloud's memory capacity.
stratechery_analysis.memory_crunch: A global memory shortage is being driven by AI demand (HBM for GPUs), making personal hardware (PCs, consoles) more expensive and less central to innovation.
stratechery_analysis.software_evolution: Software companies will use AI to write more code efficiently, but the 'per-seat' licensing model is threatened by the rise of AI agents. The battle will move to 'Work IQ' and agentic orchestration layers.
stratechery_analysis.microsoft_perspective: Microsoft is prioritizing its own AI (Copilot) over Azure rental capacity due to supply constraints, aiming to own the 'Work IQ' layer of identity and artifacts.
